onetoone_auth.name: 1:1 Authentication
onetoone_auth.description: Authentication method that verifies the user by comparing the individual's biometric data one-to-one with the biometric data stored in the database.

onetomany_auth.name: 1:N Authentication
onetomany_auth.description: Authentication method that retrieves user information from a database. It identifies an individual by comparing their biometric information with information in all registered databases.

acid.name: ACID
acid.description: The ACID represents four main properties that a transaction should have, the terminology stands for Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation and Durability. Atomicity, as the very basic operation unit, requires each transaction to be ‘all or nothing’, or simply all-success or all-fail. Consistency ensures any transaction to bring the database from one valid state to another. Isolation ensures the transaction in process must remain isolated from any other transactions. Durability ensures integrity that committed data is kept in the drive even in the event of failure for restructure.

ad_hoc.name: Ad Hoc Network
ad_hoc.description: A network that is autonomously configured by each device without reliance on network infrastructure such as a base station and an access point. In this network, a dynamic and autonomous network topology is formed despite each device communicating through a wireless interface, as each device can be moved freely thanks to a routing function that enables the distance limitations of wireless communication to be overcome.

ansi378.name: ANSI 378
ansi378.description: The fingerprint template standards defined by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI).

dhcp.name: DHCP
dhcp.description: A communication protocol used for the automatic allocation and management of settings required for TCP/IP communication.

dip_switch.name: DIP switch
dip_switch.description: A DIP switch is an On/Off switch that is used to control the behavior of a device circuit board without hardware alteration.

fail_safe_lock.name: Fail Safe Lock
fail_safe_lock.description: This means that the system enters safe mode in the event of a power outage. In the event that the power supplied to the doors is cut off due to a fire, etc., the lock will be released, thereby opening the doors.

fail_secure_lock.name: Fail Secure Lock
fail_secure_lock.description: This means that the system enters security mode in the event of a power outage. In the event that the power supplied to the doors of a critical site such as a bank is cut off, the doors will be locked.

fastcgi.name: FastCGI
fastcgi.description: FastCGI is a web-server plugin program which allows one process to handle multiple CGI(Common gateway interface) requests at once with faster speed.

hf_card.name: HF(High Frequency) Card
hf_card.description: An electronic card that operates in the 13.56 MHz band and is capable of both reading and writing data. An HF card can be fitted with various security functions, such as data encryption and allowing it to be read by a specific reader only.

http.name: HTTP
http.description: Short for Hypertext Transfer Protocol, this term refers to the protocol whereby a web client and a web server exchange data via a web browser.

https.name: HTTPS
https.description: Short for Hypertext Transfer Protocol over Secure Sockets Layer. This term refers to a protocol that provides enhanced security compared to HTTP. All data transmitted and received through HTTPS is encrypted, so HTTPS provides better security than HTTP.

ic_card.name: IC card(integrated circuit card)
ic_card.description: A card with a built-in semiconductor-based integrated circuit. Also called a smart card. IC cards are capable of both reading and writing data, and have a larger storage capacity and greater durability than magnetic cards, so the data stored on them is not damaged by contact with magnets. In addition, because IC cards can be fitted with various security functions such as data encryption and configured to be compatible only with readers that have particular specifications, they are also excellent in terms of security and functionality.

ik_rating.name: IK rating
ik_rating.description: An international rating system that defines the degree of product protection against physical impacts.

ip_rating.name: IP rating
ip_rating.description: An international rating system that defines the degree of product protection against solids and liquids.

iso19749-2.name: ISO 19749-2
iso19749-2.description: An international standard published by ISO that defines the fingerprint format information using the minutiae of fingerprints.

json.name: JSON
json.description: JSON is a form of data representation that uses characters, parentheses, and symbols to transmit data objects. It can be used in various programming languages such as PHP, C#, Python, etc.

lan.name: LAN (Local Area Network)
lan.description: A network system with communication lines that connects computers, printers, and other devices in a limited area such as in a building, so they can interact with each other.

lf_card.name: LF(Low Frequency) Card
lf_card.description: An electronic card operating in a low-frequency band of 120-140 kHz.

nc.name: NC (Normally Closed)
nc.description: An action where the relay remains closed in normal status but opens when the device operates. The current flows through the connected circuit because the relay remained closed earlier.

no.name: NO (Normally Open)
no.description: An action where the relay remains open in normal status but closes when the device operates. The current does not flow through the circuit because the relay remained open earlier.

nvr.name: NVR(Network Video Record)
nvr.description: A function that records and monitors videos of access points using cameras or video devices installed on the network, and manages events that occur.

osdp.name: OSDP(Open Supervised Device Protocol)
osdp.description: The standard RS-485 protocol developed by enhancing the Wiegand interface, through which only unidirectional communication from a reader to a controller was possible. This protocol enables processing of large amounts of data in a bidirectional reader-controller communication environment, as well as transmitting biometric data. Supporting this protocol also enables connectivity between third-party devices, so you can simply replace an existing system's items as necessary.

poe.name: PoE (Power over Ethernet)
poe.description: The system supplies power to the device through an Ethernet cable. Using a single cable to transmit data and supply power simplifies installation and expansion and reduces wiring costs.

rest.name: REST (Representational State Transfer)
rest.description: REST is an architectural style for distributed systems such as Web. REST interfaces with external systems using HTTP URI, and communicate with HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE and etc).

rf.name: RF (Radio Frequency)
rf.description: Radio frequency is an electromagnetic wave used to detect or transmit information over short or long distances. It is mainly used in communications, RFID technology, wireless networks, and other fields.

rfid.name: RFID (Radio-Frequency Identification)
rfid.description: Technology that authenticates and identifies IDs using RF (Radio Frequency). Information is stored on an RFID tag composed of an antenna and a chip, and an RFID reader reads the tag to identify the information.

rfid_tag.name: RFID (Radio-Frequency Identification) tag
rfid_tag.description: It is an electronic tag attached to a card or other object that stores unique identification information for the person or object. An RFID reader wirelessly reads the information stored on the tag using radio waves. An RFID tag typically consists of a small processor, memory, a small antenna, and a battery, and can be classified into multiple types based on whether it supports reading and writing, whether it includes an internal power source, and its RF (radio frequency) band.

rte.name: RTE (request to exit) button
rte.description: A button to open the door from inside. Pressing this button opens the door. The button can be used for doors and zones that do not require separate authentication when exiting.

rs485.name: RS-485
rs485.description: A standard protocol for serial communication that supports home networking. RS-232 has a low transfer rate and a short transmission range while RS485 enables all devices to transmit/receive data on the same line.

ssl.name: SSL (Secure Sockets Layer)
ssl.description: It refers to an encryption protocol used by web clients and web servers to ensure security and data integrity when communicating over a network.

tcpip.name: TCP/IP
tcpip.description: Abbreviation of Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol. It is a protocol for communication between computers and a combination of TCP and IP.

tls.name: TLS (Transport Layer Security)
tls.description: It refers to an encryption protocol used by web clients and web servers to ensure security and data integrity when communicating over a network.

uhf.name: UHF (Ultra High Frequency)
uhf.description: Ultra high frequency (UHF) is an electromagnetic wave with frequencies between 300 and 3,000 MHz. It is used in various communication fields, including satellite broadcasting, mobile communications such as cellular phones, terrestrial digital TV, aviation radio, and RFID technology. Because of its high frequency, it has a short wavelength of 1–10 cm and is highly directional.

voip.name: VoIP
voip.description: A communication technology that provides a voice call service based on an Internet Protocol (IP) network.

wiegand.name: Wiegand
wiegand.description: A method that transfers a small amount of data using D0 and D1. Generally it is used as a method of communication between the reader and controller of an access control device.

import.name: Import
import.description: The act of transferring data from one computer into its own system.

audit_trail.name: Audit trail
audit_trail.description: The data recorded on system changes. The audit trail makes it possible to search for information about unauthorized user activity, the processing of user activity, etc.

forced_open.name: Forced open
forced_open.description: A status in which the opening of the door has been detected by the door sensor without the occurrence of a normal door open event, such as user authentication or use of the exit button.

private_auth.name: Private authentication
private_auth.description: An authentication method where user authentication is performed according to the combination of credentials specified by the administrator. This method takes precedence over other authentication methods.

pin.name: PIN (Personal Identification Number)
pin.description: A serial number given to an individual for their identification.

alert.name: Alert
alert.description: The act of displaying or forwarding in real time an alarm event occurred in the system.

arm.name: Arm
arm.description: The act of monitoring a specific zone for the prevention of crime and accidents. 24-hour monitoring, alarm notifications, recordings, etc. are available through a security system.

intrusion_alarm_zone.name: Intrusion Alarm Zone
intrusion_alarm_zone.description: A zone set to emit a warning sound or relay signal if an unauthorized person attempts an intrusion after Arm. This zone normally begins monitoring after the day's work, and emits a preset alarm or signal when an intrusion attempt is detected.

disarm.name: Disarm
disarm.description: The act of suspending the operation of an alarm system activated for a specific zone.

zone.name: Zone
zone.description: A device group that is subject to access rules. It is used to monitor events.

aes.name: AES (Advanced Encryption Standard)
aes.description: The Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is a specification for the encryption of electronic data established by the U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

administrator.name: Administrator
administrator.description: The user who has full access to the configuration software.

optical_fp_sensor.name: Optical fingerprint sensor
optical_fp_sensor.description: A sensor that extract fingerprint information using light.

graphic_map.name: Graphic map
graphic_map.description: One of the monitoring methods provided by BioStar. This function enables you to check and control the status of doors in real time from the map.

nfc.name: NFC(Near Field Communication)
nfc.description: An RFID technology applied to mobile terminals to enable bidirectional transmission/reception of data at close range. With the rise in the smartphone penetration rate, this technology is increasingly used in various fields such as finance and communications, and it is also applied in access control in the form of mobile ID cards.

tna.name: T&A (Time and Attendance)
tna.description: A control function that collects and traces information about employees and their working hours, such as attendance and absences.

tna_rule.name: T&A rule
tna_rule.description: The rule defined by the administrator in order to assess and manage the hours worked by employees.

tna_event.name: T&A event
tna_event.description: An event that indicates the T&A (Time and Attendance) status of employees. It records the entry and exit times of employees and calculates how many hours they worked in a certain period of time.

global_zone.name: Global Zone
global_zone.description: A zone where a server and a master device are connected via TCP/IP, and the master device and a slave device are connected via RS-485. The server performs the master role for the zone.

payroll_sys.name: Payroll system
payroll_sys.description: Calculates total wages based on employees' working hours, attendance, and other tax factors to pay accurate salaries.

export.name: Export
export.description: An operation performed by a program that uses a particular data format. It is the act of storing data in a format that is compatible with other programs.

noise.name: Noise
noise.description: The electrical signals that obscure or make it difficult to identify signals.

direct_mode.name: Direct mode
direct_mode.description: A mode whereby the BioStar 2 client directly searches for connectable devices and connecting to them. In this mode, the client is responsible for communicating with devices and servers. In this mode, a list of connectable devices is shown when a device search is performed on the server, and the administrator can select a device to connect from the list.

diode.name: Diode
diode.description: A component that controls the current to flow in a single direction only. This component is used to prevent reverse current flow that momentarily occurs when the door lock operates.

short.name: Short circuit
short.description: The wires are shorted. It typically occurs due to damaged wires or overcurrent.

open.name: Open
open.description: A state in which no current flows because a wire has been broken, causing the circuit to open.

bandwidth.name: Bandwidth
bandwidth.description: A range of frequencies where certain functions can be performed; measured in hertz (Hz). The amount of information that can be transmitted over a wire or another medium over a period of time. The greater the frequency bandwidth, the more information can be sent over a certain period of time.

dummy_reader.name: Dummy Reader
dummy_reader.description: A device that does not store or assess user data, but performs the role of reading credential data such as faces, fingerprints and cards, and transmits this data to the control device.

daisy_chain.name: Daisy Chain
daisy_chain.description: A daisy chain is a wiring scheme in which hardware devices are connected together in sequence.

dbms.name: DBMS (Database Management System)
dbms.description: A DBMS is a software that controls and manages database, and interacts with a user or an application to access data in the database.

door_contact.name: Door Contact
door_contact.description: Another term for a door sensor. Magnetic sensor used to check the current state (closed/open) of a door.

synchronization.name: Synchronization
synchronization.description: The act of precisely matching time, information, etc. between different systems or networks.

eer.name: EER (Equal Error Rate)
eer.description: As an indicator of Biometric Performance, an ERR(Equal Error Rate) is a point where FAR (False Acceptance Rate) and FRR (False Rejection Rate) intersects. A device with lower EER is regarded to be more accurate.

enrollment.name: Enrollment
enrollment.description: A series of steps used to record the biometric information of users in a biometrics system. It involves sampling, template creation, storing, etc.

log.name: Log
log.description: The records of all events occurred in the system, network, device, door, etc.

local_zone.name: Local Zone
local_zone.description: A zone set via an inter-device RS-485 connection. The master role for the zone is not performed by the server but by the master device.

relay.name: Relay
relay.description: A control device that auto-executes the opening and closing of the electric circuit according to changes in the current, voltage, frequency, etc. of another electric circuit.

mag_card.name: Magnetic stripe card
mag_card.description: A card that stores data by altering the magnetism of its magnetic tape. For data transmission, the magnetic tape attached on one side of a magnetic stripe card must be read by a card terminal. Only limited types and small amounts of data can be stored on this type of card, and the data recorded on magnetic stripe cards can be altered or damaged upon contact with a magnet. In addition, because magnetic stripe cards do not provide sufficient security due to the fact that they do not use data encryption, they are increasingly being replaced by IC cards in various fields, including access control.

master_device.name: Master device
master_device.description: Among the devices that are connected through RS-485, the device that plays the role of a controller. It processes data by periodically monitoring the slave device. It is also called a host device.

matching_timeout.name: Matching timeout
matching_timeout.description: The time limit given to device matching or server matching. Matching fails if the matching does not get completed within the time limit.

man_trap.name: Man-trap
man_trap.description: A physical access control system for preventing unauthorized access and separating security zones from non-security zones.

multi_rfid.name: Multi-RFID technology
multi_rfid.description: A technology that allows cards operating in different frequency bands, such as 125 kHz and 13.56 MHz, to be read from a single device.

message_timeout.name: Message timeout
message_timeout.description: The duration of time a message is displayed when there is no user interaction.

monitoring.name: Monitoring
monitoring.description: A surveillance activity for specific purposes. Monitoring access control and time and attendance management refers to checking access control events and user time and attendance events, as well as checking and controlling the status of devices, doors and zones in real time.

model_number.name: Model number
model_number.description: A generic number given to a device by the manufacturer in order to identify its type.

mobile_card.name: Mobile card
mobile_card.description: A card that stores user data and credential data on a mobile device and performs authentications through NFC or BLE technology. Mobile cards provide higher levels of security and convenience than plastic cards, and have the advantage of reducing card issuance and management expenses because they use mobile devices used by most people daily.

wlan.name: Wireless LAN
wlan.description: A local area network that uses Radio Frequency (RF) technology. With a terminal fitted with a WLAN card, people can use a communication network within a certain distance from the place where an access point (AP)is installed.

access_point.name: AP (Access Point)
access_point.description: A device for implementing a Wireless LAN. An access point creates a connection to a wireless network through a wired LAN.

brute_attack.name: Brutal attack
brute_attack.description: Also called Brute Force Attack, this term refers to the act of entering all possible values to unlock passwords.

ups.name: UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply system)
ups.description: Provides emergency power for a certain period using a built-in battery when the main power supply is interrupted due to a power outage or other reasons. Mainly used in facilities where a stable power supply is essential, such as communication, broadcasting, medical facilities, data centers, and infrastructure facilities.

biometric_information.name: Biometric information
biometric_information.description: Information used to identify each individual. Information concerning the unique physical and behavioral characteristics of an individual, including the individual's fingerprint, signature, vein pattern, face, voice, iris, genes, etc.

biometrics.name: Biometric
biometrics.description: A technology that extracts and analyzes the physical and behavioral characteristics of individuals using an automated device for the identification of each individual.

biometric_auth.name: Biometric authentication
biometric_auth.description: The act of determining whether the provided biometric information of an individual matches the information on the individual’s Biometric characteristics previously enrolled.

semiconductor_fp_sensor.name: Semiconductor fingerprint sensor
semiconductor_fp_sensor.description: A multiple number of sensors arranged on a semiconductor that electrically detect fingerprint information.

waterproof.name: Waterproof
waterproof.description: Treatment that blocks liquids from seeping into the device due to rain or flooding and affecting its operation.

firewall.name: Firewall
firewall.description: This security system prevents unauthorized external parties from accessing the network used by individuals and organizations’ PCs to leak information or damage the system. A firewall sits at the boundary between the external internet and the internal private network, allowing or blocking incoming access attempts according to a predefined access control list.

backlight.name: Backlight
backlight.description: A light that emits from the back of the LCD of a device for readability.

backlight_timeout.name: Backlight timeout
backlight_timeout.description: The duration of time the backlight remains on.

parallel_port.name: Parallel port
parallel_port.description: Input and output port that transmits data simultaneously via a parallel interface.

security_level.name: Security level
security_level.description: The accuracy of fingerprint matching level required to identify users. At a higher security level, the False Rejection Rate (FRR) can also be higher.

secure_tamper.name: Secure Tamper
secure_tamper.description: This feature deletes all information about users, logs, encryption keys, and SSL certificates stored on the device immediately when the device is separated from the bracket and a tamper occurs.

decryption.name: Decryption
decryption.description: The act of recovering encrypted data using decryption keys. Encrypted data can only be decrypted with a symmetric key that pairs with the key used for the encryption of the encrypted data.

frr.name: FRR (False Rejection Rate)
frr.description: A criterion used when comparing the accuracy of different biometrics systems. It represents the probability of mistakenly recognizing a registered person as a non-registered person.

leave_manage.name: Leave Management
leave_manage.description: The act of managing personnel absence due to vacations, business trips, external duties, etc.

bifurcation.name: Bifurcation
bifurcation.description: A point where two fingerprint ridges meet or are separated.

blacklist.name: Blacklist
blacklist.description: A list of cards that are denied for authentication on the BioStar device. When a card is lost or stolen, misuse can be prevented by registering the ID of the card in the blacklist.

bluetooth.name: Bluetooth
bluetooth.description: A communication technology that supports bidirectional transmission and reception of data at close range. Each type of Bluetooth has different characteristics depending on the transmission distance, transmission method, power consumption, etc.

contactless_card.name: Contactless card
contactless_card.description: A card that communicates with a card terminal using its built-in coil antenna. This type of card enables transmission of data using a magnetic field without contacting a card terminal.

user.name: User
user.description: An individual that uses the Suprema device.

user_id.name: User ID
user_id.description: An identification code comprised of the alphabet, numbers, or a combination of both used to identify a certain user.

user_group.name: User group
user_group.description: A group of users that is created for ease of management. A component of the access group.

user_sync.name: User synchronization
user_sync.description: The act of automatically sending to the device the user information that has been modified on the BioStar server.

weatherproof.name: Water Resistant
weatherproof.description: This refers to a slightly lower level of waterproof performance than waterproof.

server.name: Server
server.description: A computer program that provides services to other programs, or a computer on which a server program runs.

server_matching.name: Server matching
server_matching.description: A function that compares the credential information stored on the server and the credential information entered by a user.

server_mode.name: Server mode
server_mode.description: Enter the server IP address directly on the device to connect the server and the device. Because the address is entered directly, the device is not at risk of connecting to another server or client, and if the connection is lost, it reconnects automatically to achieve a stable network environment.

sensor_sensitivity.name: Sensor sensitivity
sensor_sensitivity.description: The level of accuracy in detecting fingerprint images. With higher sensitivity, it is easier to get fingerprint images, but, because noise sensitivity increases also, it may be more difficult to perform accurate image detection.

muster_zone.name: Muster Zone
muster_zone.description: A zone designated for the gathering of members in case of an emergency such as a fire. This is used to monitor the number and roster of personnel in a certain zone, and to notify administrators via an alarm or alert if a user has remained in a particular zone for a certain period of time.

sdk.name: SDK (Software Development Kit)
sdk.description: A SDK is a set of software development tools that allows software developers to create applications for a certain software package, software framework, hardware platform, computer system, or similar development environment platform.

shrink_tube.name: Shrink tube
shrink_tube.description: Tube-shaped rubber elastomer that shrinks when heat is applied, mainly used to protect electronic device cables from breakage, corrosion, and water ingress.

suprema_template.name: Suprema template
suprema_template.description: A fingerprint template type defined by Suprema.

smart_card.name: Smart Card
smart_card.description: An electronic card that operates in the 13.56 MHz band and is capable of both reading and writing data. An HF card can be fitted with various security functions, such as data encryption and allowing it to be read by a specific reader only.

scan.name: Scan
scan.description: The act of putting a finger on the surface of the sensor or moving a finger at regular speed for the conversion of fingerprint information into digital data.

schedule_unlock.name: Scheduled Unlock
schedule_unlock.description: Opens doors in certain areas according to a predefined schedule.

schedule_lock.name: Scheduled Lock
schedule_lock.description: Locks doors in certain areas according to a predefined schedule.

slave_device.name: Slave device
slave_device.description: Among devices connected through RS-485, the device that only performs the input and output functions. It does not contain user information and is controlled by the master device.

puch.name: Punch
puch.description: An event that indicates the start time or the end time of work.

time_sync.name: Time sync
time_sync.description: A function that synchronizes the time between different devices or different systems on a network.

overtime.name: Overtime
overtime.description: The time worked that is more than the daily working hours set by the Labor Standards Act or the company regulations. Overtime may include early work, extra work, holiday work, etc.

serial_comm.name: Serial communication
serial_comm.description: A communication method that transmits multiple bits in sequence. RS-232 and RS-485 are popular examples.

meal_deduct.name: Meal deduction
meal_deduct.description: The act of excluding meal times when calculating the total number of daily working hours.

real_time_log.name: Real-time log
real_time_log.description: Records of real-time events at each access point (AP).

lvv.name: Live Video View
lvv.description: A video-based monitoring method. BioStar provides IP camera screens and event logs in real time, and supports the ability to manually open/lock doors.

analog_intercom.name: Analog intercom
analog_intercom.description: An intercom telephone that consists of an analog switch and a network.

apb.name: APB (Anti-passback)
apb.description:
A structural method used to control access. This function uses access control devices installed both inside and outside the door, so that authentication is required for access to the zone. In the case of card-based access control systems, if a person enters a zone following the person in front without swiping their card on the reader, the door does not open when the person attempts to leave the zone, and subsequently an anti-passback event occurs.
Anti-passback is categorized into hard APB and soft APB. If the anti-passback is violated, the anti-passback event is created immediately and hard APB does not permit access to the user while soft APB still permits access to the user.

alarm.name: Alarm
alarm.description: Among events occurred in the system, the type of event that requires action without delay.

alarm_action.name: Alarm action
alarm_action.description: The actions that automatically perform activities such as controlling the device and sending emails when an alarm or a certain event occurs.

password.name: Password
password.description: A string that an individual uses together with their user ID for authentication.

encryption.name: Encryption
encryption.description: The act of transforming information so that it is impossible to recognize its original meaning. Storing or transferring information in encrypted form is a way of protecting the information.

encryption_key.name: Encryption Key
encryption_key.description: A certain bit string generated for encryption. Encryption keys are designed using algorithms that prevent guessing. Generally, longer encryption keys make decryption more difficult.

access_on_card.name: Access on Card
access_on_card.description: A card on which information about a user’s ID, credential, and access group is recorded.

face_detection.name: Face detection
face_detection.description: A function that, after a user's credential has been verified, takes a picture of the user's face before granting them access so that the event and an image of the user's face can be stored together. Authentication fails if the user's face is not detected. When an image of a user's face has been stored, if necessary, it is possible to identify the user by comparing the image of the face with the user ID that was recorded when the event occurred.

face_recognition.name: Face authentication
face_recognition.description: A technology and authentication system that identifies people based on their facial features.

upgrade.name: Upgrade
upgrade.description: The act of enhancing the performance of hardware or software by replacing the existing product with a newer or improved version.

epoxy_potted.name: Epoxy potted
epoxy_potted.description: A material that protects the circuitry by preventing rainwater from entering the device if the device is installed outdoors.

live_face_detection.name: Live Face Detection(LFD)
live_face_detection.description: A technology that detects forged faces, e.g., masks and photographs.

fake_fp.name: Fake fingerprint
fake_fp.description: A fake fingerprint made from paper, silicone, rubber, etc. to emulate another individual's fingerprint.

live_fp_detection.name: Live Finger Detection(LFD)
live_fp_detection.description: A technology that detects Fake fingerprint copied using rubber, silicone, clay, glue, film, and so on.

floating_shift.name: Floating Shift
floating_shift.description: One of the attendance rules provided by BioStar. This method does not involve preset arrival and exit times, but instead applies the attendance rules of the day according to the user's arrival time.

ridge.name: Ridge
ridge.description: A ridge is a curve that represents a fingerprint, consisting of a continuous curve, an end point where the ridge is cut midway through, and a bifurcation where two ridges meet, which are called minutiae.

voice_prompt.name: Voice prompt
voice_prompt.description: A function that introduces available options to users using the recorded voice.

api.name: API (Application Programming Interface)
api.description: An API is a set of protocols, tools, and instruction for implementing software applications. In case of web application development, the API specifies how the system should send requests and what kind of corresponding responses should be expected to receive. The API may include functions like file managements, window/video/character processing to ease the application development process for the 3rd party application developers.

event.name: Event
event.description: An interaction between a user, the device, and the door. Events are recorded in a log on the BioStar server. They include authentication successes and failures and changes to the status of the door, alarms, etc.

dual_auth.name: Double mode
dual_auth.description: An authentication method where the credentials of two different individuals are entered in sequence in a limited amount of time.

auth.name: Authentication
auth.description: The act of verifying the credentials entered by a user to identify the user.

auth_mode.name: Authentication mode
auth_mode.description: A combination of credentials required for authentication.

interlock_zone.name: Interlock Zone
interlock_zone.description: A zone between two or more doors. In this zone, if one door is open or has been unlocked, the rest of the doors will be locked. This zone is generally applied to laboratories and manufacturing facilities where suspended particulate matter in the air such as dust needs to be controlled, or places where this is required for security and safety reasons.

intercom.name: Intercom
intercom.description: A communication system that is generally installed in a building or institution by using a Private Branch eXchange (PBX).

batch_enrollment.name: Batch enrollment
batch_enrollment.description: The act of registering a multiple number of access cards on the BioStar server. Registered entry cards can be allocated to individual users.

dst.name: Daylight Saving Time(DST)
dst.description: Also called summer time, DST is the practice of moving the clocks forward a certain amount of time from standard time for the purpose of saving energy through more efficient use of the daytime in the summer.

io_device.name: I/O device
io_device.description: A device that performs an information input/output function.

lock.name: Lock
lock.description: An electro-mechanical device that connects to the access control system to be used for locking the door. It refers to all electronic devices either built into or fitted to the door.

held_open.name: Held open
held_open.description: A status in which the door has remained open longer than maximum set time. Can trigger an alarm.

device.name: Device
device.description: An access control device that can be controlled in the BioStar.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: A unique number given to identify each hardware device in the BioStar.

restart.name: Restart
restart.description: The act of switching off and on by force due to an error related to program execution during device operation.

ble.name: BLE(Bluetooth Low Energy)
ble.description: A Bluetooth technology that can transmit and receive low-power, low-volume data within a distance of about 10 m by using the 2.4 GHz frequency band. Low-power Bluetooth technology is mainly applied to small devices where the supply of power is limited due to low power consumption. It is also used in access control in the form of mobile ID cards.

cde.name: CDE(Conformance Decision Engine)
cde.description: One of the procedures for Suprema's fingerprint matching algorithm. This is a step that determines whether the obtained fingerprint image is valid prior to processing the fingerprint image and extracting the minutiae of the fingerprint.

contact_card.name: Contact card
contact_card.description: A card with a gold or silver chip attached to the surface. For data transmission, a contact card must be inserted into a card terminal in order to place the chip in direct contact with the card terminal.

termination.name: Termination resistor
termination.description: This resistor is connected to the end of a daisy chain to prevent signal reflections and maintain signal quality in RS-485 communication. It reduces communication errors and ensures reliable data transmission.

intelligent_reader.name: Intelligent card reader
intelligent_reader.description: Device that stores user and access information and authenticates entered credentials to authorize user access.

fp.name: Fingerprint
fp.description: The curved patterns observed on the fingertips.

fp_sensor.name: Fingerprint sensor
fp_sensor.description: In fingerprint recognition technology, the image input device that obtains the image information of fingerprints that each represent the unique characteristics of an individual or the area on which a finger is placed, so that the fingerprint scanner can read the fingerprint.

fp_scanner.name: Fingerprint scanner
fp_scanner.description: A device that scans users' fingerprints to register them on the database.

fp_recognition.name: Fingerprint recognition
fp_recognition.description: A technology and authentication system that recognizes people based on the image information of fingerprints that are unique to individuals.

fp_scan_timeout.name: Scan timeout
fp_scan_timeout.description: The time limit for entering fingerprint information.

fp_template.name: Fingerprint template
fp_template.description: A collection of fingerprint information that consists of a series of minutiae, such as the bifurcations and the end points of ridges observed in fingerprint images. Fingerprint templates are used for the identification of fingerprints, which is carried out by comparing the locations and number of minutiae.

stp.name: Shielded twisted pair
stp.description: A cable wrapped in shielding to block external noise and reduce electrical signal interference. It is mainly used in factories or outdoors with significant signal interference, or where high-speed communication is required.

clean_room.name: Clean room
clean_room.description: A space where suspended particulate matter in air such as dust, viruses, metal powders, and cells can be controlled as required.

initialize_reset.name: Reset
initialize_reset.description: The act of restoring the settings of hardware, software, etc. to the specified default values.

mtu.name: MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit)
mtu.description: The maximum amount of packets that can be transmitted through the network.

msb.name: MSB (Most Significant Bit)
msb.description: The bit at the highest position of binary data (the left-most bit) or its content. It is the opposite of the Least Significant Bit (LSB).

lsb.name: LSB (Least Significant Bit)
lsb.description: The bit at the lowest position of binary data (the right-most bit) or its content. It is the opposite of the Most Significant Bit (MSB).

punch_in.name: Punch in
punch_in.description: The act of recording the time of arrival at the workplace.

output_relay.name: Output relays
output_relay.description: An electronically controlled device that opens/closes electrical contacts in order to affect other devices.

access.name: Access
access.description: The act of accessing a particular zone or particular assets.

access_rule.name: Access Rule
access_rule.description: A rule concerning access to a certain door/door group during a scheduled period of time.

access_group.name: Access group
access_group.description: A user group that has the right to access a specified door/door group during a scheduled period of time.

access_level.name: Access level
access_level.description: The right to access the door during a scheduled period of time.

entrance_limit_zone.name: Entrance Limit Zone
entrance_limit_zone.description: A zone that restricts access at specific times. This zone can be configured in such a way as to restrict the authentication or the authentication count.

access_control.name: Access control
access_control.description: The act of restricting unauthorized people from accessing the infrastructure and assets. Access made by authorized individuals is recorded in the log.

door.name: Doors
door.description: A place in which a physical device for access control is installed. A spatial concept that forms the basis for access control.

door_group.name: Door group
door_group.description: A group of doors created for ease of management. Events can be monitored by the door group. A component of an access group.

door_sensor.name: Door sensor
door_sensor.description: A sensor that detects the state of the door. There are various types of states such as open, closed, held open, and forced open that can be checked.

card.name: card
card.description: A portable information medium in the form of a card. It stores information for identification.

card_id.name: Card ID
card_id.description: A serial number given to a card according to the format defined by a company, organization, or department. A card ID can be either given by the card manufacturer or created in a format defined by a particular company or organization.

card_layout.name: Card layout
card_layout.description: The data arrangement and structure inside a card.

card_mode.name: Card mode
card_mode.description: A method for authenticating cardholders. There are two card modes, Card ID mode and Template-on-Card mode. The Card ID mode compares the user ID that is stored on the device with fingerprint information, in reference to the card ID stored on the card. Whereas the Template-on-Card mode identifies a user by checking whether the fingerprint entered by the user matches the fingerprint information on the card.

csn.name: CSN (Card Serial Number)
csn.description: A serial number given to a card by the manufacturer.

card_reader.name: Card reader
card_reader.description: A device that reads the information stored on cards and transmits it to the controller.

kernel.name: Kernel
kernel.description: A core component of an operating system. It manages important resources such as the memory and processes. It is loaded onto the memory at boot time to provide various basic services.

controller.name: Controller
controller.description: A device that examines access rights based on credential information obtained from a reader and controls the input and output of the reader.

credential.name: Credential
credential.description: Data used to identify users. Digital signatures, smart cards, biometric data, user names, passwords, etc. are common examples of credentials.

client.name: Client
client.description: Entity that requests service from the server through a network.

far.name: FAR (False Acceptance Rate)
far.description: Criteria used when comparing the accuracy of different biometric systems. It represents the probability of incorrectly recognizing a non-registered person as a registered person.

transaction.name: Transaction
transaction.description: A transaction is a unit of work that consists of data retrieval, updates, and other operations. In order to prevent using temporarily unmatched data from updates, a transaction is processed all at once. ACID Properties should be satisfied when a transaction is used.

tamper.name: Tamper
tamper.description: A method for monitoring the device status. A tamper can be set so that, if the device is dislocated from the bracket on which it is installed due to external factors, an alarm is activated, or the event is recorded on the server.

tailgating.name: Tailgating
tailgating.description: As one method of unauthorized access using fraudulent authentication, it refers to the act of a person who does not have access rights to a restricted area entering by following the person in front. It is also known as 'two-person entry', and is one of the most representative methods of unauthorized access along with Piggybacking. Generally, Tailgating refers to unauthorized access without intent, while Piggybacking refers to unauthorized access with intent.

template.name: Template
template.description: The stored data created from extracting and then encoding biometric features. It is used to identify a user by comparing it with the bio sample entered by the user in a biometrics system or on a biometrics device.

template_on_card.name: Template-on-Card
template_on_card.description: A method used to store the user information and fingerprint template on a smart card.

punch_out.name: Punch out
punch_out.description: The act of recording the time of departure from the workplace.

exit_button.name: Exit button
exit_button.description: A button used to open the door. Pressing this button opens the door. The button can be used for doors and zones that do not require separate authentication.

trigger_action.name: Triggered action
trigger_action.description: The actions that automatically perform activities such as controlling the device and sending emails when an alarm or a certain event occurs.

minutiae.name: Minutiae
minutiae.description: The specific details in the ridges of a fingerprint used to recognize the fingerprint.

tilting_bracket.name: Tilting bracket
tilting_bracket.description: Bracket with adjustable angle. It is primarily used with facial authentication or iris recognition devices.

firmware.name: Firmware
firmware.description: A micro program or file stored on a ROM to control the hardware of the product.

port_number.name: Port number
port_number.description: The port number used for intercommunication in TCP/UDP. Its range is from 0 to 65535.

timezone.name: Time zone
timezone.description: A geographical zone that uses the same time standard. It can be used to set the time of the device or BioStar for controlling access.

protocol.name: Protocol
protocol.description: Communication rules used to exchange data between systems or terminals.

piggybacking.name: Piggybacking
piggybacking.description: As one method of unauthorized access using fraudulent authentication, it refers to the act of a person who does not have access rights to a restricted area entering by following the person in front. It is also known as 'Piggybacking' or 'Piggyback', and is one of the most representative methods of unauthorized access along with Tailgating. Generally, Tailgating refers to unauthorized access without intent, while Piggybacking refers to unauthorized access with intent.

bypass_card.name: Bypass card
bypass_card.description: A card that enables access to a specific zone by bypassing the authentication process. For example, people who possess this card can pass through the door without the need to go through a series of security (authentication) procedures.

grace.name: Grace
grace.description: Allowable time for time and attendance rules. For instance, if you set the work start time to 9:00 and the allowable time to 10 minutes, personnel who have arrived between 9:00 and 9:10 are not deemed to have been late for work.

duress.name: Duress finger
duress.description: A fingerprint chosen to generate a certain event upon fingerprint registration. If a user authenticates himself/herself with such a fingerprint, the authentication gets recorded in a log as duress fingerprint authentication. The system administrator can set a separate alarm using the log.

fire_alarm_zone.name: Fire alarm zone
fire_alarm_zone.description: A zone set to open or lock all the doors or elevators located within it in the event of a fire.

vacation.name: Leave
vacation.description: The act of taking a leave of absence from work with a pre-specified reason/permission or the period of leave itself.

break.name: Break
break.description: A brief time taken off for rest during working hours. Each break is calculated as the time between the start and the end of the break.
